title: Rocket library + option "-C instrument-coverage" crashes the compiler apparently

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I am developing a library that has the `Rocket` as dependency. Everything seems to work fine when I am just building the library, but when I try to get coverage data, using the LLVM tool, it apparently crashes the compiler I have no deep knowledge of the compiler, and I am doing this because it popped up as a suggestion in the error, so sorry if something is not correct ### Code I can't do that, as that part is proprietary software I don't own ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.61.0-nightly (58f11791a 2022-03-17) binary: rustc commit-hash: 58f11791af4f97572e7afd83f11cffe04bbbd12f commit-date: 2022-03-17 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.61.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !value.has_escaping_bound_vars()', /rustc/58f11791af4f97572e7afd83f11cffe04bbbd12f\compiler\rustc_middle\src\ty\sty.rs:1089:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ffb99b9984f - ::fmt::h4920f17f4290f741 1: 0x7ffb99bcf79a - core::fmt::write::hcf43017332131a27 2: 0x7ffb99b8c6f9 - ::fmt::h15eaf054afd16aee 3: 0x7ffb99b9cddb - std::panicking::default_hook::h60779a00256769b9 4: 0x7ffb99b9c9ce - std::panicking::default_hook::h60779a00256769b9 5: 0x7ffb867d29e9 - ::fmt 6: 0x7ffb99b9d6ba - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::hdd4e15a6b1c4253b 7: 0x7ffb99b9d3d2 - ::get::hb3ad68c3b3cd0c37 8: 0x7ffb99b9a157 - ::fmt::h4920f17f4290f741 9: 0x7ffb99b9d0e9 - rust_begin_unwind 10: 0x7ffb99c03245 - core::panicking::panic_fmt::hd420cd5b998f1745 11: 0x7ffb99c030ec - core::panicking::panic::hc2f71ddc8d3978a9 12: 0x7ffb8abc2a79 - rustc_trait_selection[e4c1aae9ec890169]::traits::type_known_to_meet_bound_modulo_regions 13: 0x7ffb89529b74 - rustc_ty_utils[4cc541030619957e]::provide 14: 0x7ffb8952f675 - rustc_ty_utils[4cc541030619957e]::provide 15: 0x7ffb89ea4f2f - as rustc_mir_dataflow[a0aede76b6a26f86]::move_paths::abs_domain::Lift>::lift 16: 0x7ffb89fd1737 - as rustc_mir_dataflow[a0aede76b6a26f86]::move_paths::abs_domain::Lift>::lift 17: 0x7ffb8aecb4b7 - ::is_sized 18: 0x7ffb8adfb2ca - ::fmt 19: 0x7ffb8ae16369 - ::fmt 20: 0x7ffb8a013a6b - as rustc_mir_dataflow[a0aede76b6a26f86]::move_paths::abs_domain::Lift>::lift 21: 0x7ffb8a22af57 - ::try_mark_green 22: 0x7ffb8ae502b3 - ::repr_discr 23: 0x7ffb8ae3e913 - ::reg_class 69: 0x7ffb86769b33 - ::fmt 70: 0x7ffb99baca2c - std::sys::windows::thread::Thread::new::ha768f1cd2f8f32cc 71: 0x7ffc0f2e7034 - BaseThreadInitThunk 72: 0x7ffc10442651 - RtlUserThreadStart error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.61.0-nightly (58f11791a 2022-03-17) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C instrument-coverage note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [is_sized_raw] computing whether `dyn core::future::future::Future + core::marker::Send` is `Sized` #1 [layout_of] computing layout of `*const dyn core::future::future::Future + core::marker::Send` #2 [layout_of] computing layout of `core::ptr::unique::Unique + core::marker::Send>` #3 [layout_of] computing layout of `alloc::boxed::Box + core::marker::Send>` #4 [layout_of] computing layout of `core::pin::Pin + core::marker::Send>>` end of query stack ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !value.has_escaping_bound_vars()', /rustc/58f11791af4f97572e7afd83f11cffe04bbbd12f\compiler\rustc_middle\src\ty\sty.rs:1089:9 stack backtrace: note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.61.0-nightly (58f11791a 2022-03-17) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C instrument-coverage note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [is_sized_raw] computing whether `dyn core::future::future::Future + core::marker::Send` is `Sized` #1 [layout_of] computing layout of `*const dyn core::future::future::Future + core::marker::Send` #2 [layout_of] computing layout of `core::ptr::unique::Unique + core::marker::Send>` #3 [layout_of] computing layout of `alloc::boxed::Box + core::marker::Send>` #4 [layout_of] computing layout of `core::pin::Pin + core::marker::Send>>` end of query stack ```
